items.caption:
# <b1>Lesson 1
___
#  <s1>About AGP

# Objectives ____ This course begins with a lesson that walks you through AGP, including their history, products, and the procedures to follow as an employee.

_Ready to start?_

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a gallery of images

images.caption: # <b>Welcome to AGP!
## Our Mission: Grow fresh, locally grown garlic for all Australians.
We work with farmers, providing support, expertise, and specialized equipment.
AGP is the largest Australian company that grows and sells garlic to domestic supermarkets nationwide while adhering to Australian standards, including HACCP and safe quality food standards.

slides.templateDescription: Display a list of bullet points

data.prompt: Select an item to see more

list.content: Our mission has always been simple and has remained unchanged to this day; To grow fresh, locally grown garlic for all Australian's.
list.title: AGP mission statement

list.content: AGP is recognized as the leading cost-effective volume producer of Non-GMO quality-assured garlic products in Australia, reducing dependence on imports.
list.title: What is AGP recognized for?

list.content: AGP pursues continuous improvement through research, evaluation of business practices, and prioritises employee and stakeholder satisfaction.
list.title: What are AGP goals?

data.title: # More about AGP

slides.templateDescription: Select an image to see more detail

data.prompt: Select each image for more details, click the image again to go back.

images.content: For the retail markets of Australia, we offer loose garlic in 10 kg cartons or crates, a range of pre-packed products.
AGP has just released Australia's first high potency Australian SupaGarlic oil, now available in chemists and supermarket retailers.
Garlic paste is available for retail sale through supermarkets or in bulk for commercial use.

data.title: Our Products ___ ### _AGP produces a wide range of garlic varieties and garlic-related products._

answer.text: Garlic paste is indeed available for retail sale through supermarkets or in bulk for commercial use. In the retail market of Australia, supermarkets typically offer a wide range of garlic products to cater to different consumer preferences and needs.

slides.templateDescription: Display a sequence of text

content: AGP requires knowledge of the presence of all employees, visitors, and contractors at their premises at all times to effectively manage their occupational health and safety system and keep track of everyone present on site.

Hence, it is crucial for every individual to sign in when arriving and sign out when leaving the site using either the AGP clock or site leaving register available at the reception of all Australian garlic producer sites.
In case of leaving the site during work hours, one must use the leaving site Register located in the front office to sign out.
data.title: # Sign In and Sign Out

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a group of images

items.caption:
# <b>Covid-19 
# <b1>Safety Procedures

### AGP has plans to manage pandemic risks and protect everyone's health during events like Covid-19. Additional measures may be introduced, and everyone is expected to comply. These include temperature screening, testing, and staying home if unwell with symptoms. Contact AGP for further instructions if needed.

## <b2>_Let's be covid safe together._</b2>
### We can all help stop the spread of Covid-19 by making safe choices. This includes keeping physical distance, wearing a mask when necessary, and practicing good hygiene. Protect others and stay home if you're sick. If you have cold or flu-like symptoms, get tested and use the Covid Safe app.

question.content: Where can you sign in and sign out for work?

answer.text: For signing in and out, you can use either the AGP clock or the site leaving register available at the reception of all AGP sites.

data.title: Where can you sign in and sign out for work?

items.caption:
# <b1>Lesson 2
___
# <s1>Food Safety

# Objectives ____ This lesson will walk you through the types of contaminations and allergens that can affect your food. Additionally, it will cover the safe practices you'll need to follow for personal hygiene.

_Ready to start?_

slides.templateDescription: Select an image to see more detail

data.prompt: Select each image for more details

images.content: ## Microbiological Contamination Can be introduced by poor hygiene and poor cleaning practices, as well as by pests.
## Chemical contamination Can occur from poor farm chemical spraying practices, poor cleaning practices, or even poor hygiene.

## Physical Contamination Can occur if any foreign objects come into contact with the produce.

_Foreign objects include the following: Hair, fingernails, nuts, bolts, glass, wood chips, jewelry, etc._

data.title:
# <b>Types of  Food Contamination
___
### _Food contamination can seriously impact health and business. There are three main types._

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a gallery of images

images.caption: # <b> Food Allergens
Food allergens can cause critical health impacts even in small amounts and can be introduced through poor hygiene practices.
Australia's list of food allergens includes _eggs, peanuts, tree nuts, fish, mollusks, crustaceans, milk, soy, gluten-containing cereals, sesame seeds, lupins,_ and _sulfites._
Food is not be brought to the packing facility, including the foods in the food allergen list.
All staff are required to wash their hands before commencing work, after breaks, after using the toilet, after cleaning, blowing their nose, eating or smoking, and whenever required.
Using hand washing facilities each time you enter the processing area is necessary to eliminate or reduce the risk of contamination.
Wearing clean clothes and washing them regularly can also reduce the risk of cross-contamination.

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a group of images

items.caption:
AGP is proud to be a Halal-certified company. Our responsibility to our Halal certification is to not contaminate the garlic with anything “Haram” or <b2>NOT PERMITTED</b2>. 

Good hygienic practices like hand washing and no food products allowed in the factory are a requirement of your employment.

slides.templateDescription: Juxtapose two items in a slider

before.label: ## _Halal_ Is an Arabic word that means something is permitted, especially for food, based on the teachings of the _Qur'an_, a holy book for Muslims. It is the opposite of haram, meaning something is prohibited. These terms apply to various aspects of life, including _food, cosmetics, medicine,_ and _more_.

after.label: ## _Haram_ Is an Arabic word that means something is not allowed or prohibited, opposite to "Halal." This includes things like _alcohol, pork,_ and _certain animals like carnivores and birds of prey_. _Food contaminated with these forbidden things is also considered haram._

data.startPosition: Before - Start with the first section visible
data.title: Halal vs. Haram

slides.templateDescription: Draw a line between each pair

answer.text:
The correct answer for the following are...

- <s1>Microbiological Contamination</s1>: This can be introduced by poor hygiene and poor cleaning practices, as well as by pests.
- <s1>Chemical Contamination</s1>: This can occur from poor spraying practices, poor cleaning practices, or even poor hygiene. 
- <s1>Physical Contamination</s1>: Can occur if any foreign objects come into contact with the produce.

data.title: Match the contaminations with their descriptions

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a group of images

items.caption: ### To prevent food contamination, AGP has established food safety rules that, if followed, can greatly reduce the risk of incidents. Personal hygiene plays a crucial role in food safety, and maintaining a high standard of personal hygiene is essential for protecting one's own health, the health of fellow workers, and the safety of food products.

## Food safety is important, and it's everyone's job to follow the rules and guidelines set by AGP to keep food safe. If you work for AGP, you need to follow these rules to prevent food contamination. You can also report any food safety issues to your supervisor. AGP has posters around the site with tips on how to keep food safe. Our mascot Garnick will help you.

slides.templateDescription: Display long form content of any type

content.content: - Proper hand washing is important for personal hygiene and allergen control. - Wash and dry your hands thoroughly after various activities, including eating, smoking, going to the toilet, coughing, sneezing, blowing your nose, tying shoelaces, and entering the processing facility. - Wash and dry your hands after handling waste, rubbish, or items picked up from the floor. - Wash and dry your hands after cleaning, handling chemicals, doing maintenance, or using ladders. Use soap and clean water, rub your hands for 20 seconds, wash all surfaces, rinse well, and dry with a paper towel. - Use hand washing facilities each time you enter the processing area.

data.title: ## Personal Hygiene and Allergen Control

slides.templateDescription: Highlight important details in an image

waypoints.caption: # <b>Personal Hygiene and Processing Practices

To ensure food safety, clothing and personal items must not be a risk. Clothing should be in good condition, without rips or fraying edges, and certain items like jewelry and fluffy materials are prohibited.
All staff and contractors working in the production area are required to remove all jewelry, _except for plain wedding bands, and medic alerts, any visible body piercings are to be removed also_.

Only plain framed prescription glasses are allowed and must be checked and entered into a register.
Personal mobile phones and other electronic devices are not allowed in the processing area.
If you are feeling unwell or have a medical condition that may pose a risk to food safety, you should not attend work or visit the site without seeking medical clearance.

When working with food, all wounds should be covered with a blue, food-safe, waterproof dressing and gloves must be worn. Any cuts, sores, or lesions on exposed skin should be covered with a blue, food-safe dressing or disposable glove.
If you become ill at work, you should inform your supervisor and seek medical assistance if necessary.
**NO** Animals in the processing facility.

question.category: Haram is something that is forbidden.
question.content: Haram

answer.text: <s1>Haram</s1> is an Arabic word that means something is not allowed or prohibited, opposite to "Halal."

data.title: Haram is something that is forbidden.

question.content: Which of the following activities require proper hand washing for personal hygiene and allergen control?

answers.content: B. Entering the processing facility and handling waste
C. Tying shoelaces and doing maintenance
B. Entering the processing facility and handling waste
C. Tying shoelaces and doing maintenance

answer.text: Proper hand washing is important for personal hygiene and allergen control, and it is necessary to wash and dry your hands thoroughly after various activities, including eating, smoking, going to the toilet, coughing, sneezing, blowing your nose, tying shoelaces, and entering the processing facility.

items.caption:
# <b1>Lesson 3
____
# <s1>Personal Safety

# Objectives ____ This lesson will discuss the ways you can stay safe during work/operating hours. It will cover what to do in case of evacuation.

_Ready to start?_

slides.templateDescription: Highlight important details in an image

waypoints.caption: ## <b>AGP Evacuation
AGP has an evacuation plan with trained personnel and an assembly point.
If you hear an evacuation signal, stop all activities and don't run.
Use the designated or nearest safe exit to leave the building.
Go to the closest emergency assembly area or follow the emergency warden's directions. Stay at the assembly area until directed otherwise.
Don't re-enter the building during an evacuation.
Follow instructions from the emergency warden or services, which take priority over AGP's procedures.

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a group of images

items.caption: AGP wants everyone working on their sites to take responsibility for identifying and preventing anything that could harm themselves or others. It's important for employees and contractors to understand the safety rules for each site they work on.

slides.templateDescription: Select the correct answer(s)

question.category: _Choose the correct answer._
question.content: In the event of an evacuation, when do you run to the nearest exit?

answers.content: When the evacuation signal begins to fade.
When the evacuation signal begins to fade.

answer.text: If you hear an evacuation signal, stop all activities and <s1>don't run</s1>.

data.title: In the event of an evacuation, when do you run to the nearest exit?
data.subtitle: _Choose the correct answer._

slides.templateDescription: Display long form content of any type

content.content: Regardless of the site you are on, you are working as an AGP representative.

- You are required by law to act with care for others. This is called duty of care. 

- You must comply with reasonable instructions, and follow correct procedures when you are doing your job.

- It is your responsibility to wear the required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in various areas throughout the facility. 

- You must report all incidents, accidents, or near misses.

- If you have a safety problem or are not sure what to do in any situation. Seek help from your supervisor. 

- Report all breakages of glass and ceramics.

- Stop the task you are doing if you are unsure of the procedure And ask your line leader for instruction.

data.title: ## Safety and Duty of Care

slides.templateDescription: Display a long amount of content

data.content:
As an employee of AGP you need to be mindful of working around young people between the ages of 16 and 18.

Always check with a supervisor before assigning a task to a young person.

For more information check the Fair Work Act 2009 (FW Act) and the National Employment Standards (NES).
data.title: Child Labour and Young Workers

slides.templateDescription: Display a list of bullet points

list: Not to work more than 8 hours per day and 48 hours in a week.
Must not work beyond their physical and psychological capacity
Not work where there is a risk to health from cold, heat, noise or vibration.
Must not perform work involving exposure to dangerous agents (i.e. Chemicals) or radiation.
data.title: At AGP a young workers job activities are governed under the International Labour Organisation (ILO) code of standards. These include the following guidelines.

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a gallery of images

images.caption: # <b>Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Personal protective equipment (PPE) is located throughout AGP sites and is a form of control for foreseeable hazards. Most types of PPE required on-site will be provided for you by AGP.

You will need to supply several items yourself before you can commence work. These items include high-vis clothing of appropriate color, and steel cap footwear.

## <b>No PPE equals no work.
AGP will provide hairnets and beard snoods, which must be worn in the production areas specified on-site and must be removed before using bathroom amenities.
Hairnets are required to be worn in all areas of the processing plant, including cool rooms. All hair is to be encapsulated by the hairnet.

Hairnets are to be worn so as to cover the ears. Beanies are acceptable but must be covered by the hairnet. Hairnets must be worn under the hood of any hooded garment following the above requirements.

_Image source: System Hygiene UK_ Beard nets, and snoods, are required to be worn over facial hair in excess of three millimeters, approximately two days of growth, and must cover the nose. Caps are not permitted in the main processing area.
Hearing protection must be worn where specified at the site. Hearing protection with a radio is not acceptable on any AGP site area.

slides.templateDescription: Display a sequence of text

data.label: Step
content: Yellow is for all casual staff.
Orange is for production staff.
Please ensure you wear the relevant color high-vis clothing according to your position, and direct any queries to the appropriate staff member.
data.title: # AGP has a color code to help you identify staff that work throughout the packing facility...

slides.templateDescription: Highlight important details in an image

waypoints.caption: # Personal Safety
Be careful when moving around the processing facility.
Wear suitable clothing and tie back loose hair to avoid getting caught in machinery.
Do NOT wearing scarves or loose hanging clothing.
Be aware of moving mechanical parts and don't run in the facility.
Read warning signs and ask a supervisor if unsure.
Report all accidents or injuries to your supervisor and complete an incident log. If there are any obvious risks or hazards, report it to the Supervisor.

Before using machinery, make sure you know where the emergency stop buttons and pull cords are located. Only use them if there is an emergency situation, such as someone is in danger or if the machine is not working properly.

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a group of images

items.caption:
AGP provides first aid kits and trained first aiders on site.
If you're injured, notify your line leader or supervisor and seek first aid. If you cut yourself, move away from the line, apply pressure to the wound, and seek assistance from your line leader. Report all injuries to your supervisor immediately. The site has a defibrillator and trained staff to use it in case of a life-threatening emergency. An ambulance will be called if necessary.

items.caption:
# <b1>Lesson 4
____
# <s1>Workplace Safety

# Objectives ____ This lesson will provide you with insights into what to do to report an incident or a hazard. It will also cover what to refrain from while at work, including exploiting assets, smoking, drinking, and using alcohol.

_Ready to start?_

slides.templateDescription: Highlight important details in an image

waypoints.caption: # <b> Hazards and Incident Reporting
Report hazards or unsafe work conditions immediately.
Notify a Supervisor if you identify a hazard.
Report all incidents, including injuries, property damage, near misses, or security infringements to the Supervisor.
The incident register will be reviewed by the compliance manager to determine if current controls are sufficient or if further control measures are needed.

Reporting all incidents, accidents, and breakages, no matter how minor, will assist in preventing food safety incidents, injuries to personnel, or damage to plant and equipment, and aid in continuous improvement throughout the facility.

slides.templateDescription: Display long form content of any type

content.content:
- AGP has a zero-tolerance policy on the use or presence of alcohol while working on the site.
- AGP conducts random breath testing on all sites. 
- The use of alcohol may impair a person's ability to perform their job safely and efficiently.
- If suspected of being under the influence of  alcohol or other drugs, the person will be temporarily stood down.

- Disciplinary action, including termination of employment, may follow if a person is suspected of being under the influence.

data.title: Alcohol and Other Drugs

slides.templateDescription: Display long form content of any type

content.content:
- AGP has a zero-tolerance policy on the abuse or presence of illicit drugs, including the use of natural therapeutic substances given without medical advice.
- Employees, visitors, and contractors are prohibited from entering or working on the site while under the influence or in possession of illicit drugs.
- If suspected of being under the influence of drugs, the person will be temporarily stood down pending test results.
- If the temporary illness requires an employee to take medication that may affect their ability to perform work, it is recommended that the employee take the necessary time off work to ensure a complete recovery.
- If an employee is required to take prescribed medication for a prolonged period that may affect their ability to perform their job, managers must be informed and a medical certificate is to be submitted.
- Random drug screening will be carried out on all AGP sites.

data.title: Drugs

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a gallery of images

images.caption: # <b>Equal Employment and Anti-Bullying Policy
AGP aims to provide an all-inclusive workplace free from bullying, harassment, and discrimination.

All employees and contractors must behave courteously and professionally to prevent bullying, harassment, and discrimination in the workplace. Workers can  also form or join trade unions of their own choosing and bargain collectively.

<s1>There are three types of bullying:</s1> 

Verbal, social, and physical.

Verbal bullying involves saying or writing mean things, social bullying involves hurting or damaging someone's reputation or relationships, and physical bullying involves hurting a person's body or possessions.

slides.templateDescription: Select an image to see more detail

data.prompt: Select each image for more details

images.content: When using shared lunch rooms, it's important to clean up after yourself by washing your own dishes and disposing of your own rubbish to keep the area tidy. You can store your food in the refrigerators and heat it up using the microwaves provided.

Remember to cover and store all food items and drinks when not in use to prevent pests. Lockers are available for storing personal items. Do NOT store open food items in the lockers. It's recommended not to bring valuable items to work.

data.title: Staff Amenities and Personal Items

items.caption:
# <b1>Lesson 5
___
# <s1>Equipment & Site Safety

# Objectives ____ This lesson discusses the operation of machines used at work, such as forklifts and scissor lifts, as well as the best practices to follow around equipment that could be dangerous.

_Ready to start?_

slides.templateDescription: Juxtapose two items in a slider

before.label: AGP encourages continuous improvement of safety and traffic management, which involves making gradual changes to improve efficiency and safety in the packing facility.

after.label: Additionally, please follow site traffic rules, be aware of your surroundings, and avoid entering areas where forklifts are in operation.

data.startPosition: Before - Start with the first section visible
data.title: Traffic Management

slides.templateDescription: Highlight important details in an image

waypoints.caption: # <b>Forklifts
Forklift operation is only allowed for licensed and authorised personnel.
Unlicensed or unauthorised individuals found operating AGP forklifts will be required to cease work and leave the premises.
Only authorised staff may enter a forklift area.  When entering a forklift area, pedestrians are to make eye contact with the forklift driver.
Forklift drivers are required to complete a forklift safety checklist before operating a forklift each day.
Any identified damages or problems with the forklift must be reported to a supervisor immediately.

slides.templateDescription: Swipe through a gallery of images

images.caption: # <b>Scissor lifts
Scissor lift operation is only permitted for trained, competent, and authorised individuals at AGP sites.
Unauthorised operation of a scissor lift by an employee or contractor will result in work cessation and removal from the premises.
Prior to starting a shift, all scissor lift operators must perform a pre-start check to ensure safe working conditions.
Any scissor lift with damage or issues must be immediately reported to a supervisor. It is unsafe to operate a scissor lift with any unresolved problems or issues.

question.content: Prior to starting a shift, what do you do on a scissor lift?

answer.text: Before starting a shift, all scissor lift operators must perform a <s1>pre-start check</s1> to ensure safe working conditions.

data.title: Prior to starting a shift, what do you do on a scissor lift?

question.content: In order to operate on a forklift, you must...

answers.content: Be a licensed and authorised personnel.
Be a licensed and authorised personnel.

answer.text: Forklift operations must be done by licensed and authorised personnel and giving way and avoiding areas are to be done while the personnel is operating.

data.title: In order to operate on a forklift, you must...

slides.templateDescription: Display long form content of any type

content.content:
- Use only AGP-supplied PPE in processing and storage areas
- Keep product packaging and ingredients off the floor and use provided pallets or stands
- Ask supervisor or line leader if unsure about anything or need additional training
- Use only AGP-supplied SNIPS and ensure they are sharp and in good condition
- Log SNIPS in and out of the Sharps register and see line leader for instructions and maintenance
- Use only clean storage bins and pallets in good condition
- Inform supervisor or line leader before leaving processing area for any reason other than emergency evacuation.

data.title: ## The Do's of Processing Practices and Equipment

slides.templateDescription: Display long form content of any type

content.content:
- No eating, chewing gum, or lollies in processing areas
- Only water in processing areas; use provided water coolers and single use disposable cups
- No tasting of product
- No coughing or sneezing over product, use elbow or tissue then wash hands
- No spitting anywhere on site
- No glass items or mobile phones in processing areas
- PPE must not be left lying around and must be changed if contaminated or soiled
- Do not sit or stand on food contact surfaces or use crates as stools or footrests
- Product that is dropped on the floor must be disposed of.

data.title: ## The Don'ts of Processing Practices and Equipment

items.caption:
All new employees are to report to the front office at the Red Brick building on the first day of work for a site induction.

If you have not followed all instructions given in this induction you will be sent away.

question.category: _Choose the correct answer._
question.content: Which of the following statements is NOT a requirement for working in the processing and storage areas of AGP?

answers.content: B. Keep product packaging and ingredients off the floor and use provided pallets or stands.
C. Bring your own SNIPS to use for processing and cutting.
D. Use only storage bins and pallets in good condition.
E. Inform supervisor or line leader before leaving processing area for any reason other than emergency evacuation.
B. Keep product packaging and ingredients off the floor and use provided pallets or stands.
C. Bring your own SNIPS to use for processing and cutting.
D. Use only storage bins and pallets in good condition.
E. Inform supervisor or line leader before leaving processing area for any reason other than emergency evacuation.

answer.text: Employees must use SNIPS <s1>provided by AGP</s1> and make sure they are in good condition.

data.title: Which of the following statements is NOT a requirement for working in the processing and storage areas of AGP?
data.subtitle: _Choose the correct answer._

slides.templateDescription: Select the correct answer(s)

question.category: _Choose the correct answer._
question.content: Which of the following is NOT a rule in processing areas at AGP?

answers.content: A. No eating, chewing gum, or lollies
B. Only water in processing areas; use provided water coolers and disposable cups.
C. Coughing or sneezing directly over product is acceptable as long as you cover your mouth and wash your hands.
D. No spitting anywhere on site
F. No glass items or mobile phones in processing areas.
A. No eating, chewing gum, or lollies
B. Only water in processing areas; use provided water coolers and disposable cups.
C. Coughing or sneezing directly over product is acceptable as long as you cover your mouth and wash your hands.
D. No spitting anywhere on site
F. No glass items or mobile phones in processing areas.

answer.text: Coughing or sneezing directly over product is NOT allowed, even if the mouth is covered.

question.category: _Is this statement true? Choose the correct answer._
question.content: You must wash your hands prior to starting work, after breaks, after using the toilet, cleaning, blowing your nose, eating or smoking, and whenever required.

answers.content: A. You can wash your hands only after you use the toilet.
B. You can wash your hands only when you start work.
A. You can wash your hands only after you use the toilet.
B. You can wash your hands only when you start work.

answer.text: For personal hygiene and allergen control, you must always wash your hands prior to commencing work and every time you reenter the processing facility.

data.title: You must wash your hands prior to starting work, after breaks, after using the toilet, cleaning, blowing your nose, eating or smoking, and whenever required.
data.subtitle: _Is this statement true? Choose the correct answer._

question.category: _Is this statement true? Choose the correct answer._
question.content: You need to sign in or use the AGP clock when entering or leaving the site.

answers.content: A. I only need to sign in.
B. This is true, I must sign in & sign out.
C. I only need to sign at the end of the day.
A. I only need to sign in.
B. This is true, I must sign in & sign out.
C. I only need to sign at the end of the day.

answer.text: It is vital that you sign in every time you come on-site and sign out when you leave, using either the AGP clock or sign-in book, which can be found at the reception at all AGP sites.

data.title: You need to sign in or use the AGP clock when entering or leaving the site.

question.content: You should tell your supervisor if you are injured in any way?

answers.content: B. Only if it's a major injury.
B. Only if it's a major injury.

answer.text: Notify your supervisor that you have been injured, because they will help you to seek first aid.

question.category: _Choose the correct answer to complete._
question.content: In the processing area when the evacuation alarm sounds, you must...

answers.content: A. Ignore it and keep working.
B. Run out of the building.
C. Stop all activities and leave calmly via the nearest safe exit.
A. Ignore it and keep working.
B. Run out of the building.
C. Stop all activities and leave calmly via the nearest safe exit.

answer.text: If you hear the evacuation alarm or are given evacuation signal, stop all activities, do not run, and leave the building via the designated exit or the nearest safe exit.

question.category: _Is this statement true? Choose the correct answer._
question.content: Hi-vis clothing PPE must be worn. Also no jewellery should be worn except for medic alerts & a plain wedding band.

answer.text: The only permitted jewelry is either a plain, wedding band with no stones or a medical alert bracelet that must be covered.

question.category: _Is this statement true? Choose the correct answer._
question.content: Employees, contractors, and visitors must be free of drugs & alcohol & inform a supervisor if using medication.

answer.text: At AGP, it is mandatory that no employee, visitor, or contractor enters and works on site when under the influence or in possession of illicit drugs or alcohol.

data.title: Employees, contractors, and visitors must be free of drugs & alcohol & inform a supervisor if using medication.

question.category: _Choose the correct answer._
question.content: You will be dismissed if your behaviour endangers others.

answer.text: Any behavior that endangers yourself, the safety of fellow employees, or involves committing a crime while at work is grounds for dismissal.

question.content: Can I use social media to vent my dislike of another staff member?

answers.content: A. Yes, if it is outside work hours
C. Only if I don't work there
A. Yes, if it is outside work hours

answer.text: Certain conduct is inappropriate in any circumstances when you are online therefore venting on social media about another staff member is not permitted.
